ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] OT: Heads up, prevent some yahoo spamming
ygData.msgSnippet: ... for ... I m really not sure. I think you need to transfer or link your account. You may need to contact Yahoo about this. I m not certain. In addition to
ygData.messageBody:
> Question about this:
> If I joined way back with the ONElist did they make an account at yahoo
for
> me? I tried to use their id finder and failed.
> Also, if I don't have an account with them will they be blanketing the
> people on the lists with their marketing junk?
>
I'm really not sure. I think you need to transfer or link your account. You
may need to contact Yahoo about this. I'm not certain.
In addition to the spamming, they are also automatically setting people up
to be tracked online. You can opt out at
http://privacy.yahoo.com/privacy/us/pixels/details.html
I really wish they had told people about this prior to the changes or at
least when they made the changes.
luv,
-Su

> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Su" <suceress@...>
> To: <timdrake@yahoogroups.com>; <Spellbinders@yahoogroups.com>;
> <robintheboywonder@yahoogroups.com>; <OutOfOurLeague@yahoogroups.com>;
> <ON_THE_WALL@yahoogroups.com>; <LHML@yahoogroups.com>;
> <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>; <BLUDHAVEN@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Monday, April 01, 2002 8:54 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] OT: Heads up, prevent some yahoo spamming
>
>
> > Yahoo has added a "marketing" area to the account set up area of groups.
> > When you go into it you will see that they have set you to "yes" on
> > everything. I highly advise everyone to go in and change it.
> > When you're logged in at Yahoogroups, click on Account Info on the top
> right
> > corner of the screen. Enter your password when prompted, then below the
> > listing of your email addresses, you'll see a link for "Edit Marketing
> > Preferences", click on that. You'll see it's set to Yes (please send me
> > spam) on every option. Set them all to No, don't forget the two towards
> the
> > bottom of the page about phone and snail mail spam and click the button
to
> > save it.
> > Thanks to Laura Trout for passing this along.
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
> >
> >
> > Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
> >
> >
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> >
> >
>
>
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
>
>
